items: Enhanced API integration by adding OpenAPI parser library and updating related configurations.
Refactored existing tools to utilize the OpenAPI parser for improved functionality and streamlined API schema handling.
API Editor now includes the possibility to use GlobalVariables.
Agentic AI is now available with the ability to use your own OpenAI key.
General UI improvements for better usability and clarity.
Fixed minor UI bugs and alignment issues across the application.
Refactored LWC components for the AI assistant, introducing new agents and tools for enhanced functionality.
Updated configuration files and dependencies, including integration of OpenAI libraries.
Implemented audio recording features and improved message handling for a more robust assistant experience.
Streamlined UI elements for improved user experience and accessibility.
General bug fixes and performance improvements.
Added support for OpenAI as an alternative provider to Salesforce Einstein for the AI Assistant.
Integrated Mistral as an option for AI-powered autocompletion.
Enhanced AI assistant settings with provider options and model selection.
Added OpenAI bundler with new configuration files.
Integrated OpenAI agent libraries for advanced AI features.
Refactored components for improved user experience.
Updated UI elements for better accessibility and functionality.
Streamlined connection management for easier org integration and switching.
Added search functionality in SOQL Explorer for easier query and result navigation.
Optimized SObject Explorer to support multiple open tabs, allowing users to view and switch between several SObjects simultaneously.
Removed tooltips from the UI for a cleaner experience.
Fixed a minor bug in the UI for viewing orgs.
Rolled back to version 1.3.42 due to issues in later releases.

Quick bug fix related to Url Redirection.
Enhanced error handling across various components by integrating a global error store.
Implemented error dispatching in metadata loading, cache settings, and API request execution.
Introduced a footer error panel for displaying and filtering error messages, improving user experience and debugging capabilities.
Redesigned the UI for saved scripts, queries, and related items using a file tree structure, allowing for better organization and easier navigation between global and org-specific resources.
Fixed an issue where not all platform events were covered.
Enhanced platform event support to include all objects.
Added the ability to manually enter any event for greater flexibility.
Added support for 'Formula' fields, allowing users to view and interact with formula fields directly in the SObject explorer.
Enhanced the header for improved usability and navigation in the API Explorer.
Upgraded to the latest version of JSforce for improved Salesforce API compatibility and performance.
Minified the entire code base to ensure faster loading times and a smoother user experience.
MCP is now available in beta phase. Note: MCP features require installation of the DESKTOP app.
Resolved several issues related to SOAP API integration, improving reliability and error handling.
Add more 'How To' in the installation guide.
Enhance installation guide with additional 'How To' sections.
Implement new shortcut settings for various applications, improving user navigation experience.
Refactor API request handling and error management in the Electron integration for better performance and reliability.
Handle MCP (Model Context Protocol) for the Desktop Version.
Remove outdated release notes file.
Update version to 1.3.39.
Refactored user login flow for smoother experience and to support future enhancements.
Added option to modify the ClientId during login.
Introduced ability to select the apiVersion id during login.
Added 'Manual Login' option allowing users to directly enter sessionId or username/password combo.
Added classic 'username/password' authentication support (not recommended for security reasons).
Improve release experience/guide
Add option to enable/disable the overlay from the extension menu and from the settings
Fix issues related to the previous version preventing user from opening the toolkit
Add more "How To" in the installation guide.
Provide granular control over the URL/Domains where the toolkit is injected, allowing users to directly add URLs.

Implemented sophisticated caching architecture to optimize data storage and retrieval
Improved performance in SOQL, Metadata and SObject explorers through background metadata caching and asynchronous updates
Removed unused fields.
Add Caching manager to improve caching mechanism in the long run.
Add back the Header UI tab (settings -> Show Header Application Tabs).
Hide sensitives settings in case user is sharing his screen.
Missing icons in the injected overlay.
All editors now have a copilot button to help you write your queries, code, etc. To activate it, you need to have an OpenAI key configured in the settings.
The shortcut to activate the copilot is `CTRL/CMD + K` while the editor is focused.
This feature is available in all editors in Beta phase
Resolved an issue preventing user from using Shortcuts and configuring them in the settings. (Another issue)
Fixed an issue where the shortcut was not being saved in the settings and preventing the extension from injecting the shortcuts in the Salesforce Page.
It's now possible to use the picklist suggestion in the SOQL Editor.
Fixed an issue where the Metadata Explorer was not displaying the correct data.
Fixed an issue that prevented to display Metadata originated from the Metadata API (Such as CanvasMetadata, etc...)
Fixed an issue where the Package Manager was not displaying the metadata selector.

Selecting a metadata type in the menu shares the view with the Metadata Explorer, resulting in the last selection being reflected in both the Metadata Explorer and the Package Manager due to their shared Redux state.
Resolved an issue preventing user from using Shortcuts and configuring them in the settings.
Instance Url was missing from the Org -> Company information component.
Introduced the ability to open the Data Explorer directly from the Record Viewer (right panel) with a prepopulated query. This streamlines the workflow and saves time.
Resolved an issue where the UI would break if the `Id` field was not selected.
Fixed an issue where certain redirection links were not functioning as expected.
Introduced a user-friendly interface for visualizing records, akin to the "Chrome Panel" experience.
Enabled direct editing of records within the Record Viewer app, streamlining workflows.
Added support for record deletion directly from the SOQL interface.
Implemented query formatting to enhance readability and usability.
Improved error handling for OAuth session management. If the registered org is not found or the session has expired, a popup message will now notify the user.
Resolved various metadata-related issues to improve reliability and performance.
The Application Tab has been removed to simplify navigation and improve user experience.
Improved performance for faster data retrieval and processing.
Added multi-tab support to enhance user experience and facilitate simultaneous metadata exploration.
Enabled shortcuts for Save & Run operations:
`CTRL/CMD + S` to Save
`CTRL/CMD + Enter` to Run
Introduced commenting functionality using `//` to exclude parts of a query for better query management.
Fixed the issue with the loading spinner during authorization and redirection to an organization.
Adjusted font size for improved readability.
Enhanced UI for handling large files by integrating Monaco and Workbench visualizers.
Completely redesigned user interface for a modern look and improved usability.
Introduced a "Multi-Tab" feature for streamlined navigation across applications.
Added functionality to deploy packages to Salesforce or retrieve them from Salesforce efficiently.
Integrated an overlay into Salesforce pages to enable quick search and navigation.
Laid the groundwork for a future "bridge" between the app and the Chrome extension.
Transformed the cloud-based application into a fully functional browser-based app, eliminating the need for a proxy server.
Optimized load times and overall application responsiveness for a smoother user experience.
Expanded support for additional Salesforce APIs, enhancing the toolkit’s capabilities.
Improved performance by executing Access Analyzer computations using web workers.
Fixed an intermittent bug preventing some users from logging in to their Salesforce accounts.
Resolved occasional data synchronization failures between the toolkit and Salesforce.
